answers.answer: I'm 37 weeks and have had swollen ankles and feet and hands for a week now. Dr said it's normal twords the end.  I would just have them check at next appointment.

Sit down for about 15 min check blood pressure again and if it's constantly high call. If it doesn't run that high normally it's something you should probably call on. It could just be ur blood pressure going up. My sister in law had hers go way up towards the end of both her pregnancies. It can be harmful to the placenta. I had it last pregnancy starting at 27 weeks and had him at 37 and now 35+4 and mine is up and down so I just keep a close eye on it.
Those are signs I had with my twins, I would call the on call. They admitted same day.
You should just go to the er. If it is your BP you can go into liver failure.

question: Has anyone experienced this? My ankles swelled up kinda suddenly. Had a mild headache yesterday. Took my blood pressure and it was 140/100. I'm 38+4. Wondering if I should call the on call doc or wait until tomorrow
title: Preeclampsia
